title: If you are 0/7, don't flash and take the kill from your teammates who will secure it...
body:
If you are 0/7, you are practically worthless in terms of gold. Now that you've net a kill, you're worth gold again. Not only do you hurt the team but you will for sure feed that gold right back to the enemy team. Just don't do it. It hurts the team and helps the enemy team.


EDIT to clarify I was 1 AA away from the kill with both flash and Wukong E up. The guy (MF supp) flashes over and gets the kill. He's nonstop feeding to Ezreal every minute. He could use the flash to maybe prevent Ez from netting a kill. Instead he selfishly wastes summ, takes kill from already snowballing Wukong (I was 4/1 she is 0/7).

ok so instead of trying to get back into the game and gain some gold and exp for me and maybe put myself off tilt just for getting a kill ill continue to feed so im worthless 

great advice
If it is a for sure kill it is never worth burning your flash for it. Just, never. Now if you needed to secure the kill go ahead.
its not about the flash.. that isnt the OP point he is talking about if you are 0-7 you dont need to get the kill or gold cuz your worthless
No, he specifically states not to waste flash on a kill that is already secured. Read the title. He is stating you will feed back the kill because you just burnt your flash for no reason.
once again flashing inst the important part.. flash or no flash the context is if youre 0-7 you dont need the kill and give it to him cuz he is carrying and the 0-7 player is worthless
Flash is the most important part of what he is saying. The entire point of the argument revolves around the wasted flash, but apparently we will have to agree to disagree.

If you are 0/7, you are practically worthless in terms of gold. Now that you've net a kill, you're worth gold again. Not only do you hurt the team but you will for sure feed that gold right back to the enemy team. Just don't do it. It hurts the team and helps the enemy team.

read the context not the title
The title is part of the context, you can't just ignore a part of it to create and form an argument you want to make.
yet your ignore the actual context of what he wrote not the title

I haven't ignored anything, I took everything into account. If you burnt your flash and are 0-7 you are likely putting yourself in repeatedly bad positions. This means that you will want your flash to be able to avoid another one of these situations that will happen. Wasting it to get a kill with then result in not having it and making it much easier for the enemy to feed off of you again. 

Now please, tell me how I somehow avoided the context unlike yourself.

irregardless of you burn flash or not his point is 

If you are 0/7, you are practically worthless in terms of gold. Now that you've net a kill, you're worth gold again. Not only do you hurt the team but you will for sure feed that gold right back to the enemy team. Just don't do it. It hurts the team and helps the enemy team.

That's my fault I didn't clarify since I included flash in title I assumed it was already included as part of OP text. But it doesn't matter. It was already a secured kill. The guy who did it was support MF. I was snowballing and fed. She was 0/7. And she fed more after that.
but the 1st problem was the MF support cuz it worked in a PRO game in a certain coordinated team synergy it must be broken and work no matter what right ?
Nah not necessarily I don't knock people about their champ pick but this guy was clearly just out of his head. I found out now that he was way below our rank and was getting boosted by his ADC.
so the flash wasnt the important part right?

Flash was an important aspect of it but it was a whole entire collective. First of all, she is not playing safely. As MF supp there is a certain way you should play her in order to succeed otherwise it's not going to work against a kill lane with hard engage. Next, not having flash means she will most assuredly feed more which she did. Second, I was snowballing and I already got Riven top and Annie mid fed as hell. I just needed more time, secure drag, and then could turn the tide bot with Annie. It was a collection of stuff. Please don't argue and get into a rage fest on my account. None of this is targeted towards you; just selfish teammates who think kills > winning game.

i understand that... so whether or not she blew flash to take that kill isnt the point the point she was feeding and dead weight and taking the kill in theory kept you from continuing your lead and snowballing plus making her worth something to focus and kill for the enemy team

still taking it.

people that are 0/7 are desperate for gold.

that gold can be the tipping point for your team to make a comeback.

Is everyone else missing the whole don't waste a flash for a secured kill part or am I just seeing that in the title? The guy is right, if the kill is already secured there is no reason for you to flash for it.

fine lets reiterate.

if im support and i flash kill in that situation yes dumbass move

for other scenario's look at my previous comment.

Don't care about any other scenario. If you are 0-7 it is like 20+ minutes in. At that point wasting a flash to secure an already 100% secured kill is beyond a bad move. It just makes no sense to ever do and cannot possibly be justified unless you are playing vs low level opponents where the need of having flash in mid-late games doesn't matter.

I'm on the fence about this.

1) I agree with you, She used her flash to KS an indifintie kill. Her bad.
BUT
2) can't blame her, by the looks of it the player isn't player her properly ( especially as MF support zzz)

It's a nice PSA, but honestly, nothing else to be done.

I have had fights where i did 99% of the work (1v1), and another champ comes in for the gank and KS. It a feelsbad moment, but i got the assist and I moved on.

I think it is more important not to waste a flash.

If you're 0/7 I think it is fair to say that you aren't playing safe enough, or paying attention to the map, so you will need that instant disengage sooner rather than later. 

That one kill that was already secured was not worth your spell. I see people take summoner spells for granted so much in low ELO. It is tragic.

I agree with that; the flash could have been used to prevent opposing laner from netting another kill. Supp MF selfishly wasted flash on a secured kill to steal it... because he's simply a selfish player.

> I agree with that; the flash could have been used to prevent opposing laner from netting another kill. Supp MF selfishly wasted flash on a secured kill to steal it... because he's simply a selfish player.

I can't believe people are trying to justify a stupid move like that. MF support or no MF support, wasting a flash like that is a bad idea. You will absolutely regret it. You aren't going to end up carrying if you keep making mistakes like that.

If the enemy gets you to waste summoner spells then it isn't as bad as it would be if they died without getting the enemy to waste them. I don't get why people that are posting aren't getting that.

There's a reason people type in the chat that a flash or exhaust is down.

I don't really give a shit which part anyone here considers the important part.

If you're 0/7 you shouldn't be in this conversation trying to decide on what's best for your team cause you OBVIOUSLY don't know what the right call is in the first place.

You're the problem.

Humble yourself enough to understand that the people carrying you obviously know better than you.

Take the kill so your team gets more gold, let some salty tryhard cry about it, ignore them, and make comeback.

Flashing just to get kill gold instead of assist gold is a bit questionable, though, but flashing to get kill gold instead of nothing is quite ok in some situations.
It wasn't a kill vs nothing situation, did you even read the OP?
